metadata.Title: CVE-2021-4217 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in unzip. The vulnerability occurs due to improper handling of Unicode strings, which can lead to a null pointer dereference. This flaw allows an attacker to input a specially crafted zip file, leading to a crash or code execution.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-4217` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

unzip - 6.0-26ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: unzip package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.0-26ubuntu3.1').
